verses.verse: The words <S%H1697><s%> of king <S%H4428><s%> Lemuel; <S%H3927><s%> the oracle <S%H4853><s%> which his mother <S%H517><s%> taught him. <S%H3256><s%>
"Oh, <S%H1248><s%> my son! Oh, <S%H1248><s%> son of my womb! <S%H990><s%> Oh, <S%H1248><s%> son of my vows! <S%H5088><s%>
Don't <S%H5414><s%> give your strength <S%H2428><s%> to women, <S%H802><s%> nor your ways <S%H1870><s%> to that which destroys <S%H4229><s%> kings. <S%H4428><s%>

It is not for kings, <S%H4428><s%> Lemuel; <S%H3927><s%> it is not for kings <S%H4428><s%> to drink <S%H8354><s%> wine; <S%H3196><s%> nor for <S%H335><s%> princes <S%H7336><s%> to say, <S%H7941><s%> 'Where is strong drink?'
lest they drink, <S%H8354><s%> and forget <S%H7911><s%> the law, <S%H2710><s%> and pervert <S%H8138><s%> the justice <S%H1779><s%> due to anyone who is afflicted. <S%H1121><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> strong drink <S%H7941><s%> to him who is ready to perish; <S%H6><s%> and wine <S%H3196><s%> to the bitter <S%H4751><s%> in soul: <S%H5315><s%>
Let him drink, <S%H8354><s%> and forget <S%H7911><s%> his poverty, <S%H7389><s%> and remember <S%H2142><s%> his misery no more. <S%H5999><s%>
Open <S%H6605><s%> your mouth <S%H6310><s%> for the mute, <S%H483><s%> in the cause <S%H1779><s%> of all who are left <S%H1121><s%> desolate. <S%H2475><s%>
Open <S%H6605><s%> your mouth, <S%H6310><s%> judge <S%H8199><s%> righteously, <S%H6664><s%> and serve <S%H1777><s%> justice to the poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy. <S%H34><s%>"
Who can find <S%H4672><s%> a worthy <S%H2428><s%> woman? <S%H802><s%> For her price <S%H4377><s%> is far <S%H7350><s%> above rubies. <S%H6443><s%>
The heart <S%H3820><s%> of her husband <S%H1167><s%> trusts <S%H982><s%> in her. <S%H2637><s%> He shall have no lack of gain. <S%H7998><s%>
She does <S%H1580><s%> him good, <S%H2896><s%> and not harm, <S%H7451><s%> all the days <S%H3117><s%> of her life. <S%H2416><s%>
She seeks <S%H1875><s%> wool <S%H6785><s%> and flax, <S%H6593><s%> and works <S%H6213><s%> eagerly <S%H2656><s%> with her hands. <S%H3709><s%>
She is like the merchant <S%H5503><s%> ships. <S%H591><s%> She brings <S%H935><s%> her bread <S%H3899><s%> from afar. <S%H4801><s%>

She rises <S%H6965><s%> also while it is yet night, <S%H3915><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> food <S%H2964><s%> to her household, <S%H1004><s%> and portions <S%H2706><s%> for her servant girls. <S%H5291><s%>
She considers <S%H2161><s%> a field, <S%H7704><s%> and buys <S%H3947><s%> it. <S%H6529><s%> With the fruit of her hands, <S%H3709><s%> she plants <S%H5193><s%> a vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>
She arms <S%H2296><s%> her waist <S%H4975><s%> with strength, <S%H5797><s%> and makes her arms <S%H2220><s%> strong. <S%H5797><s%>
She perceives <S%H2938><s%> that her merchandise <S%H5504><s%> is profitable. <S%H2896><s%> Her lamp <S%H5216><s%> doesn't <S%H3518><s%> go out by night. <S%H3915><s%>
She lays <S%H7971><s%> her hands <S%H3027><s%> to the distaff, <S%H6418><s%> and her hands <S%H3709><s%> hold <S%H8551><s%> the spindle. <S%H3601><s%>
She opens <S%H6566><s%> her arms <S%H3709><s%> to the poor; <S%H6041><s%> yes, <S%H7971><s%> she extends her hands <S%H3027><s%> to the needy. <S%H34><s%>
She is not afraid <S%H3372><s%> of the snow <S%H7950><s%> for her household; <S%H1004><s%> for all her household <S%H1004><s%> are clothed <S%H3847><s%> with scarlet. <S%H8144><s%>
She makes <S%H6213><s%> for herself carpets of tapestry. <S%H4765><s%> Her clothing <S%H3830><s%> is fine linen <S%H8336><s%> and purple. <S%H713><s%>
Her husband <S%H1167><s%> is respected <S%H3045><s%> in the gates, <S%H8179><s%> when he sits <S%H3427><s%> among the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the land. <S%H776><s%>
She makes <S%H6213><s%> linen <S%H5466><s%> garments and sells <S%H4376><s%> them, <S%H5414><s%> and delivers sashes <S%H2289><s%> to the merchant. <S%H3669><s%>
Strength <S%H5797><s%> and dignity <S%H1926><s%> are her clothing. <S%H3830><s%> She laughs <S%H7832><s%> at the time <S%H3117><s%> to come. <S%H314><s%>
She opens <S%H6605><s%> her mouth <S%H6310><s%> with wisdom. <S%H2451><s%> Faithful <S%H2617><s%> instruction <S%H8451><s%> is on her tongue. <S%H3956><s%>
She looks well <S%H6822><s%> to the ways <S%H1979><s%> of her household, <S%H1004><s%> and doesn't <S%H398><s%> eat the bread <S%H3899><s%> of idleness. <S%H6104><s%>
Her children <S%H1121><s%> rise up <S%H6965><s%> and call her blessed. <S%H833><s%> Her husband <S%H1167><s%> also praises her: <S%H1984><s%>
"Many <S%H7227><s%> women <S%H1323><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> noble <S%H2428><s%> things, <S%H5927><s%> but you excel them all."

Charm <S%H2580><s%> is deceitful, <S%H8267><s%> and beauty <S%H3308><s%> is vain; <S%H1892><s%> but a woman <S%H802><s%> who fears <S%H3373><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> she shall be praised. <S%H1984><s%>
Give <S%H5414><s%> her of the fruit <S%H6529><s%> of her hands! <S%H3027><s%> Let her works <S%H4639><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> her in the gates! <S%H8179><s%>
